question: Why do South Asian women who migrate to Kuwait often experience internal conflicts while economically supporting their families?

answers.text: Migration satisfies their personal ambitions for travel and cultural discovery, but they contribute very little to the economic well-being of their families.
They often prepare their native cuisines and maintain South Asian gender roles, but those who adopt Islamic cultural practices are paid higher wages.
The daâ€™wa classes, which they are required to take, are so expensive that they diminish the amount of money that can be sent home.
They experience profound personal change when adapting to a new culture, but their natal families expect them to behave the same once they return.
